notesStmt.note: Several folios slightly mutilated. Slightly stained.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A book of mostly kabbalistic commentaries on Genesis, Exodus and parts of Leviticus by Mordekhai Dato, written in Italian in Hebrew characters (an autograph).

collation.p: Original quiring not established due to the modern restoration (leaves on guards).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian cursive script of the 16th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Black buckram. Spine title: 'Mordekhai Dato. Derashoth. Ital. Brit. Mus. Additional 27, 050.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), Italian bibliophile: his manuscript no. 156: inscribed ([347v]); 322 Hebrew manuscripts were acquired from his library in October 1865 through Adolphus Asher (b. 1800, d. 1853), Berlin bookseller and dealer to the British Museum 1841-1853.
